intro: Dentella repens var. serpyllifolia, commonly known as匍匐百里香, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features prostrate stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats of foliage. The leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Small, pinkish-white flowers appear in clusters during the summer months. This plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
